reviews.review_msg: He is honestly one of the best profs I have ever had. His lectures are entertaining, his assignments are easy if you keep up with the readings, and he has been super accomodating during the pandemic.

Great guy. Understanding and chill. If you're having trouble with a concept or need an extension, just ask and he's happy to help. Sometimes I got bored in class but that was more to do with my short attention span than his teacher. He's a good pick. P.S. He may go on a rant about hating Tom Hanks once or twice!

Honestly one of the best professors I've had, he has genuine passion for teaching and film. You can tell he enjoys what he does and it shows in his lectures. He's not at all preachy and you can see how much he enjoys seeing students do well. Super easy to connect with as well.
Awesome professor, very knowledgeable and passionate about the subject. The course is pretty easy if you just show up, watch the movies and participate a bit in the tutorials.

To him the term 'lecture' means sitting comfortably on the side and playing three YouTube videos on a particular subject. The way he plans the course is absurd and has no explained correlation between weekly subjects. Assignments are purely theoretical and leave no room for creative thinking (to the point of him giving us the title). Never again :/

don't take this prof if you have accommodations. A student needs subtitles this semester and complained in front of the class about it when HE did not check the film for subtitles beforehand. It caused us to go majorly over time into many people's tutorials. He did not explain then and let the (awful) film play + just read from the slides
